p: In normal conditions without epidemic, the air should be free of any viruses. Upon SARS-CoV-2 outbreak, when COVID-19 patients cough, sneeze, or even talk, they could shed SARS-CoV-2 into the air, and air transmission may exist within 1 m in close proximity of COVID-19 patients. Thus, the public worry about the possibility of SARS-CoV-2 flowing in the air.
